result.name: domestic-energy-factfile-energy-efficiency-of-the-british-housing-stock1
result.notes:
The purpose of this report is to gather together in one volume data on important trends related to domestic energy use, and in particular on the measures that have been taken to improve energy efficiency. Most of the tables relate to total housing stock and will be mainly of use to Government Departments and others interested in research or planning at that level. The reports cover the period from 1970 (just before the first oil crisis) until the present.

The series consists of a main fact file with figures for the GB housing stock. This has a full explanation of the background behind the topics covered and includes information that is only available at the GB level. The other two fact files break the data down by tenure (owner occupied, council rented, private rented and registered social landlord) and country (England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland).

Published by Building Research Establishment Ltd

organization.name: cambridgeshire-insight
organization.title: Cambridgeshire Insight
organization.description: The Cambridgeshire Insight Partnership is made up of public, health and community bodies to provide a shared research knowledge base for the Cambridgeshire area. It allows users an easy way to access and share data, information and research for deeper insights about their local area. See more at https://cambridgeshireinsight.org.uk

result.title: Domestic Energy Factfile - energy efficiency of the British housing stock

resources.description: Updates the previous domestic energy fact file, includes data up to 2006. Looks at consumption and projections, fuel prices, population, housing stock, improvements in insulation, water tanks and energy efficiency.

resources.description: Provides energy usage trends and efficiency in homes of the UK. The data is broken down into the countries of the UK: England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

resources.description: A techinical research report using decomposition analysis to determine how effective the UK has been in reducing intos energy efficiency and carbon emisions. Data used between 1970 - 2001.
resources.name: The historical role of energy efficiency in reducing carbon emissions from UK housing stock
